newsitem.title: USA: TSR says its software shows promise.
newsitem.headline: TSR says its software shows promise.

text.p: TSR Inc said Thursday that an undisclosed Fortune 500 publishing company told it that a test conducted for the company using TSR's CATCH/21 software on an 80,000 line COBOL program was a "success."
The software is aimed at fixing the so-called Year 2000 bug, a glitch in many computers that makes them unable to accurately recognize dates from the year 2000 and beyond.
TSR said the company told it that it intends to hire TSR to convert the company's IBM mainframe applications to make them "Year 2000 compliant."

TSR also said it has entered into an agreement with an unnamed Fortune 500 pharmaceutical company to convert a COBOL application to demonstrate that TSR's CATCH/21 software will meet the company's expectations.
